<item><title>Exclusive: U.S. plans new wave of immigrant deportation raids</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/exclusive-u-plans-wave-immigrant-deportation-raids-175843268.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Om5lecb2GRcXgjMmJCo_Tw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T184231Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B1LY_RTROPTP_2_USA-IMMIGRATION-DEPORTATION.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="ICE officers during an operation targeting criminal aliens and other immigration violators in Philadelphia Pennsylvania" align="left" title="ICE officers during an operation targeting criminal aliens and other immigration violators in Philadelphia Pennsylvania" border="0" /></a>By Julia Edwards WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. immigration officials are planning a month-long series of raids in May and June to deport hundreds of Central American mothers and children found to have entered the country illegally, according to sources and an internal document seen by Reuters. The operation would likely be the largest deportation sweep targeting immigrant families by the administration of President Barack Obama this year after a similar drive over two days in January that focused on Georgia, Texas, and North Carolina. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) has now told field offices nationwide to launch a 30-day &quot;surge&quot; of arrests focused on mothers and children who have already been told to leave the United States, the document seen by Reuters said.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/exclusive-u-plans-wave-immigrant-deportation-raids-175843268.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:09:34 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">exclusive-u-plans-wave-immigrant-deportation-raids-175843268</guid><media:content url="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Om5lecb2GRcXgjMmJCo_Tw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T184231Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B1LY_RTROPTP_2_USA-IMMIGRATION-DEPORTATION.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/exclusive-u-plans-wave-immigrant-deportation-raids-175843268.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Om5lecb2GRcXgjMmJCo_Tw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T184231Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B1LY_RTROPTP_2_USA-IMMIGRATION-DEPORTATION.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="ICE officers during an operation targeting criminal aliens and other immigration violators in Philadelphia Pennsylvania" align="left" title="ICE officers during an operation targeting criminal aliens and other immigration violators in Philadelphia Pennsylvania" border="0" /></a>By Julia Edwards WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. immigration officials are planning a month-long series of raids in May and June to deport hundreds of Central American mothers and children found to have entered the country illegally, according to sources and an internal document seen by Reuters. The operation would likely be the largest deportation sweep targeting immigrant families by the administration of President Barack Obama this year after a similar drive over two days in January that focused on Georgia, Texas, and North Carolina. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) has now told field offices nationwide to launch a 30-day &quot;surge&quot; of arrests focused on mothers and children who have already been told to leave the United States, the document seen by Reuters said.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Obama administration to issue transgender restroom guidance to schools</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/u-issue-decree-transgender-access-school-restrooms-ny-012216218.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Qo8BEHbqJGB6G_fE9CcVFA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T012216Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C01Q_RTROPTP_2_USA-TRANSGENDER-CALIFORNIA.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="A gender neutral bathroom is seen at the University of California, Irvine" align="left" title="A gender neutral bathroom is seen at the University of California, Irvine" border="0" /></a>The Obama administration will tell every U.S. public school district on Friday to allow transgender students to use the bathrooms that match their gender identity. The letter, signed by officials from the Education and Justice departments, does not have the force of law but contains an implicit threat that schools which do not abide by the Obama administration&#039;s interpretation of the law could face lawsuits or a loss of federal aid. &quot;There is no room in our schools for discrimination of any kind, including discrimination against transgender students on the basis of their sex,&quot; U.S. Attorney General Loretta Lynch said in a statement.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/u-issue-decree-transgender-access-school-restrooms-ny-012216218.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:47:51 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">u-issue-decree-transgender-access-school-restrooms-ny-012216218</guid><media:content url="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Qo8BEHbqJGB6G_fE9CcVFA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T012216Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C01Q_RTROPTP_2_USA-TRANSGENDER-CALIFORNIA.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/u-issue-decree-transgender-access-school-restrooms-ny-012216218.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Qo8BEHbqJGB6G_fE9CcVFA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T012216Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C01Q_RTROPTP_2_USA-TRANSGENDER-CALIFORNIA.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="A gender neutral bathroom is seen at the University of California, Irvine" align="left" title="A gender neutral bathroom is seen at the University of California, Irvine" border="0" /></a>The Obama administration will tell every U.S. public school district on Friday to allow transgender students to use the bathrooms that match their gender identity. The letter, signed by officials from the Education and Justice departments, does not have the force of law but contains an implicit threat that schools which do not abide by the Obama administration&#039;s interpretation of the law could face lawsuits or a loss of federal aid. &quot;There is no room in our schools for discrimination of any kind, including discrimination against transgender students on the basis of their sex,&quot; U.S. Attorney General Loretta Lynch said in a statement.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>U.S. Navy fires commander of sailors who were held by Iran</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/u-navy-fires-commander-sailors-were-held-iran-000952547.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/SoiTZ3o7wIsNbbOjREOLvg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T225725Z_2_LYNXNPEC4B1SM_RTROPTP_2_IRAN-ANNIVERSARY.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Iranian students re-enact a scene from the arrest of American sailors by Iran&#039;s Revolutionary Guard, during a ceremony marking the 37th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution, in Tehran" align="left" title="Iranian students re-enact a scene from the arrest of American sailors by Iran&#039;s Revolutionary Guard, during a ceremony marking the 37th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution, in Tehran" border="0" /></a>The U.S. Navy said on Thursday that it had fired the commander of the 10 American sailors who wandered into Iranian territorial waters in the Gulf in January and were briefly held by Iran in an incident that risked becoming an international crisis. The Navy said in a statement that it had lost confidence in Commander Eric Rasch, who was the executive officer of the coastal riverine squadron that included the 10 sailors. Rasch became the first person to be publicly singled out after a preliminary investigation into the incident that occurred near Farsi Island in the Gulf.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/u-navy-fires-commander-sailors-were-held-iran-000952547.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:09:52 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">u-navy-fires-commander-sailors-were-held-iran-000952547</guid><media:content url="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/SoiTZ3o7wIsNbbOjREOLvg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T225725Z_2_LYNXNPEC4B1SM_RTROPTP_2_IRAN-ANNIVERSARY.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/u-navy-fires-commander-sailors-were-held-iran-000952547.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/SoiTZ3o7wIsNbbOjREOLvg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T225725Z_2_LYNXNPEC4B1SM_RTROPTP_2_IRAN-ANNIVERSARY.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Iranian students re-enact a scene from the arrest of American sailors by Iran&#039;s Revolutionary Guard, during a ceremony marking the 37th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution, in Tehran" align="left" title="Iranian students re-enact a scene from the arrest of American sailors by Iran&#039;s Revolutionary Guard, during a ceremony marking the 37th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution, in Tehran" border="0" /></a>The U.S. Navy said on Thursday that it had fired the commander of the 10 American sailors who wandered into Iranian territorial waters in the Gulf in January and were briefly held by Iran in an incident that risked becoming an international crisis. The Navy said in a statement that it had lost confidence in Commander Eric Rasch, who was the executive officer of the coastal riverine squadron that included the 10 sailors. Rasch became the first person to be publicly singled out after a preliminary investigation into the incident that occurred near Farsi Island in the Gulf.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Navy SEALs invite public to honor fallen SEAL killed in Iraq</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/navy-seals-invite-public-honor-fallen-seal-killed-070829845.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/NIG.tM7nzd.EE4L2nNqobQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/ap_webfeeds/bb867dcb441abe18980f6a706700bdc6.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="FILE - This undated U.S. Navy file photo shows Special Warfare Operator 1st Class Charles Keating IV, 31, of San Diego. The Navy SEALs are inviting people to line the streets in the military town of Coronado, to honor fallen SEAL Keating, as his remains are transported across the Coronado Bridge to San Diego to be buried at Fort Rosecrans National Cemetery, in Calif. The special warfare operator was killed May 3, 2016, in a gunbattle with Islamic State fighters in Iraq and is the third service member to die in the country since U.S. forces returned there in 2014. (U.S. Navy Photo via AP, File)" align="left" title="FILE - This undated U.S. Navy file photo shows Special Warfare Operator 1st Class Charles Keating IV, 31, of San Diego. (U.S. Navy Photo via AP, File)" border="0" /></a>SAN DIEGO (AP) — The U.S. Navy SEALs are inviting people to line the streets in the military town of Coronado on Friday to honor the special warfare operator killed in Iraq.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/navy-seals-invite-public-honor-fallen-seal-killed-070829845.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:08:29 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">navy-seals-invite-public-honor-fallen-seal-killed-070829845</guid><media:content url="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/NIG.tM7nzd.EE4L2nNqobQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/ap_webfeeds/bb867dcb441abe18980f6a706700bdc6.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/navy-seals-invite-public-honor-fallen-seal-killed-070829845.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/NIG.tM7nzd.EE4L2nNqobQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/ap_webfeeds/bb867dcb441abe18980f6a706700bdc6.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="FILE - This undated U.S. Navy file photo shows Special Warfare Operator 1st Class Charles Keating IV, 31, of San Diego. The Navy SEALs are inviting people to line the streets in the military town of Coronado, to honor fallen SEAL Keating, as his remains are transported across the Coronado Bridge to San Diego to be buried at Fort Rosecrans National Cemetery, in Calif. The special warfare operator was killed May 3, 2016, in a gunbattle with Islamic State fighters in Iraq and is the third service member to die in the country since U.S. forces returned there in 2014. (U.S. Navy Photo via AP, File)" border="0" /></a>SAN DIEGO (AP) — The U.S. Navy SEALs are inviting people to line the streets in the military town of Coronado on Friday to honor the special warfare operator killed in Iraq.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>'Folks back home' have varying views on N. Carolina LGBT law</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/folks-back-home-varying-views-n-carolina-lgbt-065358415.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/18H.voUrVpbh9c32KGRHpg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/ap_webfeeds/311e5c167b914d9daa96eb18c623b84e.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="In this photo taken Thursday, May 12, 2016, signage is seen outside a restroom at 21c Museum Hotel in Durham, N.C. North Carolina is in a legal battle over a state law that requires transgender people to use the public restroom matching the sex on their birth certificate. The ADA-compliant bathroom signs were designed by artist Peregrine Honig. (AP Photo/Gerry Broome)" align="left" title="In this photo taken Thursday, May 12, 2016, signage is seen outside a restroom at 21c Museum Hotel in Durham, N.C. North Carolina is in a legal battle over a state law that requires transgender people to use the public restroom matching the sex on their birth certificate. The ADA-compliant bathroom signs were designed by artist Peregrine Honig. (AP Photo/Gerry Broome)" border="0" /></a>EDEN, N.C. (AP) — In defending a law limiting protections for LGBT people, North Carolina&#039;s powerful Republican Senate leader recently said that &quot;folks back home&quot; couldn&#039;t understand the outcry that&#039;s included loud demonstrations, and dozens of arrests, over the law.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/folks-back-home-varying-views-n-carolina-lgbt-065358415.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:02:00 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">folks-back-home-varying-views-n-carolina-lgbt-065358415</guid><media:content url="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/18H.voUrVpbh9c32KGRHpg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/ap_webfeeds/311e5c167b914d9daa96eb18c623b84e.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/folks-back-home-varying-views-n-carolina-lgbt-065358415.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/18H.voUrVpbh9c32KGRHpg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/ap_webfeeds/311e5c167b914d9daa96eb18c623b84e.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="In this photo taken Thursday, May 12, 2016, signage is seen outside a restroom at 21c Museum Hotel in Durham, N.C. North Carolina is in a legal battle over a state law that requires transgender people to use the public restroom matching the sex on their birth certificate. The ADA-compliant bathroom signs were designed by artist Peregrine Honig. (AP Photo/Gerry Broome)" align="left" title="In this photo taken Thursday, May 12, 2016, signage is seen outside a restroom at 21c Museum Hotel in Durham, N.C. North Carolina is in a legal battle over a state law that requires transgender people to use the public restroom matching the sex on their birth certificate. The ADA-compliant bathroom signs were designed by artist Peregrine Honig. (AP Photo/Gerry Broome)" border="0" /></a>EDEN, N.C. (AP) — In defending a law limiting protections for LGBT people, North Carolina&#039;s powerful Republican Senate leader recently said that &quot;folks back home&quot; couldn&#039;t understand the outcry that&#039;s included loud demonstrations, and dozens of arrests, over the law.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>German economy accelerates, grows 0.7 percent in 1st quarter</title><description>BERLIN (AP) — The German economy accelerated in the first quarter, growing 0.7 percent compared with the previous three-month period thanks to spending at home and mild winter weather that boosted construction, official data showed Friday.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/german-economy-accelerates-grows-0-061714809.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:01:55 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">german-economy-accelerates-grows-0-061714809</guid></item><item><title>World's oldest person dies in New York City, aged 116</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/worlds-oldest-person-dies-york-city-aged-116-064332359.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/zvBrRPJAZXl8.WioS.efhA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T064332Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C099_RTROPTP_2_USA-NEW-YORK-OLDEST.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Susannah Mushatt Jones (C), known as &quot;Miss Susie&quot; is wheeled into a celebration for her 116th birthday with family members, local dignitaries, and friends in the Brooklyn borough of New York" align="left" title="Susannah Mushatt Jones (C), known as &quot;Miss Susie&quot; is wheeled into a celebration for her 116th birthday with family members, local dignitaries, and friends in the Brooklyn borough of New York" border="0" /></a>Jones&#039; death makes Emma Morano-Martinuzzi, a 116-year-old woman in Italy, the oldest living person, according to the Gerontology Research Group. Jones, who was born in the southern U.S. state of Alabama in 1899, was the daughter of sharecroppers and granddaughter of slaves. After graduating from high school she moved north in 1922 to New Jersey and then New York, where she worked as a housekeeper and childcare provider, according to Guinness World Records and the Vandalia Senior Center in the New York City borough of Brooklyn, where she lived.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/worlds-oldest-person-dies-york-city-aged-116-064332359.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:43:32 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">worlds-oldest-person-dies-york-city-aged-116-064332359</guid><media:content url="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/zvBrRPJAZXl8.WioS.efhA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T064332Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C099_RTROPTP_2_USA-NEW-YORK-OLDEST.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/worlds-oldest-person-dies-york-city-aged-116-064332359.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/zvBrRPJAZXl8.WioS.efhA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T064332Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C099_RTROPTP_2_USA-NEW-YORK-OLDEST.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Susannah Mushatt Jones (C), known as &quot;Miss Susie&quot; is wheeled into a celebration for her 116th birthday with family members, local dignitaries, and friends in the Brooklyn borough of New York" align="left" title="Susannah Mushatt Jones (C), known as &quot;Miss Susie&quot; is wheeled into a celebration for her 116th birthday with family members, local dignitaries, and friends in the Brooklyn borough of New York" border="0" /></a>Jones&#039; death makes Emma Morano-Martinuzzi, a 116-year-old woman in Italy, the oldest living person, according to the Gerontology Research Group. Jones, who was born in the southern U.S. state of Alabama in 1899, was the daughter of sharecroppers and granddaughter of slaves. After graduating from high school she moved north in 1922 to New Jersey and then New York, where she worked as a housekeeper and childcare provider, according to Guinness World Records and the Vandalia Senior Center in the New York City borough of Brooklyn, where she lived.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Jury convicts man accused of fleeing jail, killing woman</title><description>KITTANNING, Pa. (AP) — A man accused of escaping from a Pennsylvania jail and killing an acquaintance who lived nearby has been convicted of murder.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/jury-convicts-man-accused-fleeing-jail-killing-woman-064234400.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:42:34 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">jury-convicts-man-accused-fleeing-jail-killing-woman-064234400</guid></item><item><title>"Geek Love" author Katherine Dunn dead at 70</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/geek-love-author-katherine-dunn-dead-70-041003507.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Y62nV0P9WPbJkJqkQVkr_w--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/ap_webfeeds/db31e0764413be18980f6a70670077be.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="In this 2009 photo, journalist and author, Katherine Dunn, makes a visit to one of boxing news sources at the Matt Dishman Community Center &amp; Pool boxing gym, in Portland, Ore.
